initiative_system.name: Streamlined Initiative
initiative_system.setup: At the beginning of a combat encounter, each combatant declares their stance. Then, each character rolls a d10 and adds their Agility attribute. The results are sorted from highest to lowest to create the initiative queue. Ties are resolved by the combatant with the highest Agility score.

stances.name: Offensive
stances.effect: Gain a +2 bonus on your first attack roll in combat.

stances.name: Supportive
stances.effect: No modifier. Maintain a balanced position.

stances.name: Defensive
stances.effect: Gain a +2 bonus to your first defensive action.

turn_structure.actions: On a combatant's turn, they can take one major action (Attack, Cast an ability, or Use an item) and one movement action.
turn_structure.reactions: In addition to their regular actions, a combatant has one 'Reaction' per round that can be taken in response to a specific trigger.

hybrid_zonal_combat.name: Hybrid Zonal Combat
hybrid_zonal_combat.description: A combat system that blends abstract tactical zones with grid-based movement, allowing for both narrative positioning and tactical precision.

zones.name: Front Line
zones.description: Represents direct engagement with the enemy. This zone is typically 15 ft deep.

zones.name: Back Line
zones.description: A protected area for ranged and support characters, typically 20-30 ft behind the Front Line.

movement_actions.movement_action: A character can use their Movement Action to move a number of feet equal to their Agility x 5 within their current zone. This is used for precise positioning to get into range for abilities or to engage specific enemies.
movement_actions.minor_action: A character can use a Minor Action to switch between adjacent zones (e.g., moving from the Back Line to the Front Line).

targeting_rules.melee_attacks: Can target any enemy in an adjacent zone (e.g., a character in your Front Line can attack an enemy in their Front Line).
targeting_rules.ranged_attacks: Use their listed range in feet. The GM will provide the approximate distance between zones at the start of combat.
targeting_rules.opportunity_attacks: Using a Minor Action to 'Move Zones' out of an enemy's direct melee reach (5 ft) will provoke an Attack of Opportunity.

unified_defense_roll.description: When a creature is targeted by a physical attack, the attacker and defender make opposed rolls.
unified_defense_roll.attack_roll: Determined by the weapon's 'attack_profile' property. See 'attack_roll_profiles' for formulas.

defense_roll.might_based: If Might >= Agility: 1d10 + Might + Combat Skill. (Flavor: Block/Parry)
defense_roll.agility_based: If Agility > Might: 1d10 + Agility + Athletics Skill. (Flavor: Dodge/Weave)

unified_defense_roll.resolution: If the Attack Roll is equal to or greater than the Defense Roll, the attack hits. Otherwise, it misses. In the case of a tie, the attack is considered a glancing blow and deals half damage.

critical_hit.trigger: Natural 10 on a d10 attack roll.
critical_hit.effect: The attack is an automatic hit. The attacker rolls double the normal number of damage dice.

critical_fumble.trigger: Natural 1 on a d10 attack roll.
critical_fumble.effect: The attack is an automatic miss.

death_and_dying_rules.applicability: These rules apply only to the hero and their named companions. All other creatures die at 0 Vitality.
death_and_dying_rules.massive_damage_rule: If overkill damage from a single hit is >= (Might + Spirit + Level), the character dies instantly. This also applies to attacks on a Downed character.
death_and_dying_rules.downed_state: At 0 Vitality, a character becomes Downed and Unconscious.
death_and_dying_rules.death_saves: A Downed character makes a 1d10 Death Save at the start of their turn. 6+ is a success, 2-5 is a failure, 1 is two failures. 3 successes = Stable. 3 failures = Death.
death_and_dying_rules.getting_help: An ally can stabilize a Downed character with a DC 14 Mind (Survival) check or a Healer's Kit. Any healing restores consciousness.
death_and_dying_rules.damage_while_downed: Taking damage while Downed causes one automatic death save failure (two on a critical hit).

weapon_properties.name: Finesse
weapon_properties.description: When making an attack with this weapon, you can choose to use your Agility attribute instead of your Might attribute for the attack and damage roll.

weapon_properties.name: Versatile
weapon_properties.description: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. When wielded with two hands, it deals a larger die of damage (e.g., a Sword deals 1d8 with one hand, 1d10 with two).

weapon_properties.name: Heavy
weapon_properties.description: This weapon is larger and requires two hands to use. Characters with a Might score below 3 have a -2 penalty on attack rolls with a heavy weapon.

weapon_properties.name: Sunder
weapon_properties.description: Attacks with this weapon reduce a target's Damage Reduction by 2 for 1 round.

weapon_properties.name: Bleed
weapon_properties.description: On a critical hit with this weapon, the target gains the 'Bleeding' status effect.

weapon_properties.name: Momentum
weapon_properties.description: If you move at least 15 feet in a straight line before making an attack with this weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

weapon_properties.name: Relentless
weapon_properties.description: When you defeat an enemy with this weapon, you can immediately use a bonus action to move up to 10 feet.

weapon_properties.name: Concussive
weapon_properties.description: On a successful hit with this weapon, the target must make a Might check (DC 13) or be pushed back 5 feet.

weapon_properties.name: Grapple
weapon_properties.description: On a successful hit with this weapon, you can choose to forgo damage to attempt to Grapple the target as a bonus action.

weapon_properties.name: Disarm
weapon_properties.description: When you critically hit with this weapon, the target must make a Might check or drop one item they are holding.

weapon_properties.name: Returning
weapon_properties.description: If this weapon is thrown, it automatically returns to the wielder's hand at the end of the turn.

weapon_properties.name: Point-Blank
weapon_properties.description: This ranged weapon does not have disadvantage on attack rolls when used within 5 feet of an enemy.

weapon_properties.name: Siege
weapon_properties.description: This weapon deals double damage to objects, structures, and constructs.

weapon_properties.name: Reach
weapon_properties.description: Allows the wielder to make melee attacks against targets up to 10 feet away.

weapon_properties.name: Paired
weapon_properties.description: If you are wielding two of these weapons, you can add your Agility modifier to the damage of the second attack.

weapon_properties.name: Channel
weapon_properties.description: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to cast a cantrip or a Novice-tier ability.

weapon_properties.name: Rally
weapon_properties.description: When you score a critical hit with this weapon, one ally within 15 feet of you gains temporary Vitality equal to your Spirit attribute.

weapon_properties.name: Overwhelm
weapon_properties.description: When you make an attack with this weapon, you can choose to take a -2 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, the target has a -2 penalty to their next defensive roll.

weapon_properties.name: Execute
weapon_properties.description: This weapon deals an additional 1d8 damage against any creature that is suffering from a negative status effect.

weapon_properties.name: Improvised
weapon_properties.description: This weapon can be thrown using the `Martial (Agility)` profile (Range 20/60). It is not designed for throwing and may be damaged or lost.
